questions.question_text: Which role does the Adjacency-SID sub-TLV extension perform in the IS-IS routing protocol?

choices.B: It is advertised within TLV-145 (IS-IS Prefix Reachability Information) to label host prefixes on loopback interfaces on Level 2 routers within one IS-IS area
choices.C: It is advertised within TLV-24 (IS-IS Neighbor Adjacency Attribute) to label a specific adjacency between Level 1 routers within one IS-IS area
choices.D: It is advertised within TLV-22 (Extended IS Reachability) to label a specific link in a segment routing domain
choices.A: It is advertised within TLV-136 (Extended IP Reachability) to label a specific node in the network.

questions.question_text: A network engineer must collect traffic statistics for an internal LAN toward the internet. The sample must include the source and destination IP addresses the destination ports, the total number of bytes from each flow using a 64-bit counter and all transport flag information. Because of CPU limits, the flow collector processes samples that are a maximum of 20 seconds long. Which two configurations must the network engineer apply to the router? (Choose two.)

choices.A:
cache timeout active 20
template data timeout 120
choices.B:
cache-period timer active 20
data export timeout 2

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
Copilot Response:
Option A: This configuration sets the active timeout for the cache to 20 seconds, which aligns with the requirement that the flow collector processes samples that are a maximum of 20 seconds long. The template data timeout 120 command is used to specify the interval for exporting template records to the collector.
Option E: This configuration includes commands to match the IPv4 protocol, source address, destination address, transport destination-port, and interface output. It also includes commands to collect the IPv4 source mask, source prefix, destination prefix, transport TCP destination-port, counter bytes long (64-bit counter), flow direction, and transport TCP flags. These commands align with the requirement to collect traffic statistics including the source and destination IP addresses, the destination ports, the total number of bytes from each flow using a 64-bit counter, and all transport flag information.

choices.A: Trace the attack that flows from the attacked sections of the network toward the network edges
choices.B: Detect unusual activity or behavior and activate appropriate measures after an alert is raised
choices.D: Mitigate the attack that flows using various mechanisms

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer : In the six-phase approach to service provider security, the traceback phase involves tracing the path of the attack as it moves through the network. This is done to identify the origin and progression of the attack, which helps in understanding how it propagates and aids in mitigating its impact.

questions.question_text: Which action occurs during the traceback phase of the six-phase approach to service provider security?

choices.D: Chef is written in Python and SaltStack is written in Ruby.
choices.C: Chef uses a message-based system and SaltStack uses an agent to deliver messages.
choices.B: Chef refers to its automation instructions as manifests and SaltStack refers to its instructions as a playbook
choices.A: Chef is an agent-based tool based on Ruby and SaltStack is a module tool based on Python
